content: I am releasing R4 of FHIR. (yay!) Part of this process is to take down the old R3 at http://hl7.org/fhir, and then upload the new R4. The take down is happening, so http://hl7.org/fhir is broken for a little while (a day or so). R3 will remain available at http://hl7.org/fhir/STU3

Grahame. Thanks to you and the team for all of your great work on making this happen.

One small note. I noticed that going to http://fhir.hl7.org redirects to http://hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/ which shows STU3 and states "This is the Current officially released version of FHIR"

Not sure if you had just not gotten to it yet, but I wanted to make sure you were aware.
ok, everything is copied up now. I still have to post the extension definitions for the versions - tomorrow morning my time
if you're not seeing R4 where you think it should be visible, remember to flush your cache before escalating

if you're not seeing R4 where you think it should be visible, remember to flush your cache before escalating

Should http://hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/history.html be reflecting R4 under the Major Milestones, and in table below ? Thanks
if you're not seeing R4 where you think it should be visible, remember to flush your cache before escalating
@Grahame Grieve I just saw that for R4 the json schema for each resource is no more available (ex: http://hl7.org/fhir/STU3/Patient.schema.json). Is it permanent or they will be added? Thanks.
that is permanent. There is only one JSON schema now
We have distinct XML schemas for each FHIR release. Why would we not do the same for JSON?
As @Nilesh Pagare pointed out, the versions page still doesn't include the R4 changes for me: http://hl7.org/fhir/history.html
@Grahame Grieve The page footer refers to this as: FHIR Release 4 Candidate - can we remove Candidate?
ok thanks both. Copy error on the first, all pages now fixed

On the "history" page @Pascal Pfiffner and @Nilesh Pagare mentioned (http://hl7.org/fhir/history.html), in addition to not seeing R4, I also noticed that the link for STU3 points to DSTU2. (Actually, all the links under "Major milestones" point to DSTU2).

The box at the top of http://hl7.org/fhir/ says This is the Current officially released version of FHIR, which is R4. For a full list of available versions, see the Directory of published versions . The link for "R4" points to http://hl7.org/fhir/history.html which has not been updated, but the link for "Directory of published versions" points to http://hl7.org/fhir/directory.cfml which seems to be up to date
Discussion/issue identification on #implementers or #social please
